wikipedia_page.main: Malcolm  Alexander Murray (born March 1955) is a Scottish businessman and former Chairman of Rangers Football Club.

response: *Malcolm Murray (Swedish Army officer) (1904–1995), Swedish Army lieutenant general
*Malcolm Murray, 12th Earl of Dunmore (born 1946), Australia-based Scottish peer
*Sir Malcolm Murray-MacGregor, 4th Baronet (1834–1879) of the MacGregor baronets
*Malcolm Murray (businessman) (born 1956), former chairman of Rangers FC

link_mentions.page: Administration and liquidation of The Rangers Football Club plc
response: Charles Green responded by ridiculing what he saw as the posturing of Walter Smith and John Brown: "It's not right that every two weeks a Mel Gibson appears, delivers a Braveheart statement, then doesn't deliver anything." Malcolm Murray, installed as Chairman of Rangers, appealed for an end to "factionalism" and said: "The vicious bloodlust must end, not only for Rangers’ sake but for Scottish football."
